intro: Cruciata ciliata f. laevicaulis, commonly known as the smooth-leaved cruciata, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are smooth and slightly hairy along the edges. Its flowers are typically yellow and arranged in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
